com.ibm.gaiandb.draw

Class Chart

  • java.lang.Object
    • Display
      • com.ibm.gaiandb.draw.DatabaseDiagram
        • com.ibm.gaiandb.draw.Chart
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarChart, ChartLegend, ConnectedSeriesChart, TimeChart

    public abstract class Chart
extends DatabaseDiagram
    Represents a chart, which in reality is just a visual frontend for a prefuse Table structure. Retrieves data from a prepared SQL statement and renders it according to the subclass.
    Author:
    Samir Talwar - stalwar@uk.ibm.com

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class com.ibm.gaiandb.draw.DatabaseDiagram

    • Field Detail

      • COPYRIGHT_NOTICE

        public static final java.lang.String COPYRIGHT_NOTICE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • data

        protected Table data
        Stores the data to be rendered in the chart.

      • vt

        protected VisualTable vt
        A version of data that provides access to graphical and visual properties.

      • statement

        protected final java.sql.PreparedStatement statement
        The prepared statement that is executed on every update. It may have unbound parameters - these are set on each update via arguments to populateTable(java.lang.Object...) and updateTable(java.lang.Object...).

      • firstStatementVar

        protected final int firstStatementVar
        The first parameter of statement to be set when updating the table through populateTable(java.lang.Object...) or updateTable(java.lang.Object...). Any parameter before this will be set once in the constructor, and then left alone.

      • keys

        protected final java.util.Set<java.lang.String> keys
        A set of field names that can be used to compare two rows in data for row equality. Used to decide whether to add a row or update an existing one. The keys are set by the concrete class.

      • maxDuration

        protected int maxDuration
        The maximum duration the data in the chart should be left alive. Implementation (or lack thereof) is left to the concrete subclass.

      • colorAction

        protected ColorAction colorAction
        Used by prefuse to determine the chart colors.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chart

        public Chart(java.sql.PreparedStatement statement,
             java.lang.Object... params)
      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new chart, using the provided PreparedStatement as the method of data retrieval. The parameters are added to the prepared statement as permanent bound objects. Any unbound parameters are bound on each update via populateTable(java.lang.Object...) or updateTable(java.lang.Object...) for the lifecycle of the update.
        Parameters:
        statement - The prepared statement to use when retrieving data for updates.
        params - The parameters to be permanently bound to the prepared statement.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if binding parameters fails.

    • Method Detail

      • getMaxDuration

        public int getMaxDuration()
        Retrieves the maximum time the data in the chart should be left alive.
        Returns:
        The maximum duration of the data in the chart, in seconds.

      • setMaxDuration

        public void setMaxDuration(int maxDuration)
        Sets a new maximum for the lifetime of data in the chart.
        Parameters:
        maxDuration - The maximum duration of the data in the chart, in seconds.

      • getColorAction

        public ColorAction getColorAction()
        Retrieves the diagram's color action. Color actions are used by prefuse to determine the colors used in the chart.
        Returns:
        A prefuse color action.

      • setColorAction

        public void setColorAction(ColorAction colorAction)
        Sets the new color action. Color actions are used by prefuse to determine the colors used in the chart.
        Parameters:
        colorAction - The new color action.

      • populateTable

        public void populateTable(java.lang.Object... params)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method binds the parameters provided to the prepared statement, executes it and creates a new data structure from the result. It then creates a new visualization and prepares it for rendering.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters to be bound to the prepared statement. These will not overwrite those bound in the constructor, but will be appended to the end of them.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • updateTable

        public void updateTable(java.lang.Object... params)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method binds the parameters provided to the prepared statement, executes it and adds the result to its internal data structure. It then updates and redraws the visualization.
        Parameters:
        params - The parameters to be bound to the prepared statement. These will not overwrite those bound in the constructor, but will be appended to the end of them.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

                     throws java.sql.SQLException
